definition: lit. to support the sky as a single pillar (idiom)/fig. to take a crucial responsibility upon one's shoulders
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
pillar/CL:根[gen1]
to raise (hand)
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: At the middle of the piazza, stood an obelisk.
sentences.chinese: 在广场的正中央，是根一柱擎天的埃及方尖碑。

definition: amazing powers/miraculous skill
lit. heroism reaching to the clouds (idiom)
(cry of encouragement)/to arise/to stand up/to gain the ascendancy/Come on!
to force oneself upon sb (idiom)/to rape
to produce clouds with one turn of the hand and rain with another (idiom); fig. to shift one's ground/tricky and inconstant/to make love
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
to vanquish dragons and tigers (idiom)
burning with desire
vigor/virility/dynamism/(literary) powerful wind
like a hungry tiger pouncing on its prey
golden rooster stands on one leg (tai chi posture)/standing on one leg
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
the five fingers of one's hand
to appear suddenly/projection/bit sticking out
lit. where tigers crouch and dragons coil (idiom); fig. forbidding terrain
to subdue a tiger/fig. to prevail over sinister forces
